techmeme.title: Banking trade body UK Finance: while 60% of all UK adults used mobile banking in 2023, people mainly using cash for everyday spending increased 66% YoY (Claer Barrett/Financial Times)
A dozen technologists and researchers at Chinese tech companies say open-source technologies were a key reason behind China narrowing the AI gap with the US (New York Times)
Analysis: the shipping industry faced 64+ cyber attacks in 2023, up from ~20 in 2022, as geopolitical disputes prompt state-linked hackers to target trade flows (Financial Times)
Indian crypto exchange WazirX announces a controversial plan to "socialize" the ~$230M loss from its recent security breach among all its customers (Manish Singh/TechCrunch)
Musk reposts an edited Kamala Harris campaign video that mimics her voice, possibly with deepfake tech; it has 104M+ views and seemingly breaks X's own rules (Ken Bensinger/New York Times)
